hedline.hl1: Edison Officer Convicted Of Robbing a Bank

abstract.p: Federal jury in Newark, NJ, convicts Edison Police Officer Robert Spinello of robbing First Savings Bank of Edison (S)

block.p: A federal jury yesterday convicted an Edison police officer of robbing a local bank an hour before reporting for duty.
The officer, Robert Spinello, 32, faces 50 years in prison on armed robbery and related charges when sentenced on Sept. 6. His lawyer, Lawrence S. Lustberg, said an appeal was being considered.
A federal jury yesterday convicted an Edison police officer of robbing a local bank an hour before reporting for duty.
The officer, Robert Spinello, 32, faces 50 years in prison on armed robbery and related charges when sentenced on Sept. 6. His lawyer, Lawrence S. Lustberg, said an appeal was being considered.

The United States attorney's office, which prosecuted the case in United States District Court in Newark, said Officer Spinello was arrested the day of the holdup, Jan. 13, 1999, after a patron of the First Savings Bank in Edison wrote down the license number of the sport utility vehicle of Officer Spinello's wife.

The police later found $3,500 in cash, the amount that had been taken, in an Edison condominium Officer Spinello owned. Prosecutors said the officer wanted to pay off $40,000 in credit card debt the couple had run up.
